The lives of Clemens Alexandrinus, Eusebius, Bishop of Cæsarea, Gregory Nazianzen, and Prudentius, the Christian poet containing an impartial account of their lives and writings, together with several curious observations upon both : also a short history of Pelagianism / written originally in French by Monsieur Le Clerc ; and now translated into English. Le Clerc, Jean, 1657-1736.
[8], 389 p.
Printed for Richard Baldwin ..., London : 1696.
Translation of an unidentified work in French. Errata: p. [8]. Reproduction of original in Yale University Library. "The history of Pelagianism": p. 334-389.
=======

Le Clerc, Jean, 1657-1736.
[8], 389 p.
Printed for Richard Baldwin ..., London : 1696.
